basics.name: Nicholas Backshall
basics.label: Robotics Research Engineer
basics.summary: Experienced robotics research engineer with a background in robot learning, imitation learning, and reinforcement learning algorithms for robot manipulation.

work.name: Dyson Robot Learning Lab
work.summary: Conducted cutting-edge research in robot learning, focusing on sample-efficient imitation learning and reinforcement learning algorithms for robot manipulation.
highlights: Developed and maintained internal imitation learning and reinforcement learning environments
Developed and maintained internal real-world robot learning infrastructure
Line managed an engineer
Co-authored two publications in IEEE Robotics and Automation Letters and CoRL 2024
Developed novel action space formulation for over-actuated robot arms
Created BiGym, a benchmark for mobile bi-manual demo-driven robotic manipulation
Engineered custom embedded systems for dexterous manipulation

work.name: Dyson
work.summary: Designed and developed iOS and Android applications to support testing and validation of new product concepts in upstream product development.
highlights: Developed Android Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) Library
Designed cross-platform messaging protocol for device communication
Implemented embedded comunication protocols in GoLang, JavaScript, Python, and other languages

work.name: Dyson
work.summary: Created AR applications and developed the Dyson AQ App for air quality monitoring.
highlights: Created AR application rendering high-fidelity particle systems using Metal and Metal-Shading-Language
Developed Dyson AQ App for air quality monitoring
Created data mocking tool using AWS Lambda

work.name: Dyson
work.summary: Contributed to the development of the MyDyson Android application.
highlights: Implemented new front-end features
Fixed bugs and improved existing functionality
Practiced Test-Driven Development (TDD)

work.name: Dyson
work.summary: Worked across mechanical, electrical, and software engineering departments on various projects.
highlights: Developed manufacturing strategies
Analysed circuit board schematics
Created debug platforms for cloud data
Conducted user studies and engineered automated rigs
Designed high voltage system architectures
Prototyped new attachments for consumer products

education.institution: The University of Warwick & Dyson Institute of Engineering and Technology (fully sponsored by Dyson)
education.studyType: First Class Bachelor of Engineering (with Honours)

publications.name: BiGym: A Demo-Driven Mobile Bi-Manual Manipulation Benchmark
publications.summary: Created BiGym, a new benchmark and learning environment for mobile bi-manual demo-driven robotic manipulation.

publications.name: Redundancy-aware Action Spaces for Robot Learning
publications.summary: Developed a novel action space formulation, ER (End-effector Redundancy), addressing redundancies in over-actuated robot arms.
